captions.text:
Having the opportunity to design this kit
is a truly humbling experience.

This kit represents the nationality and the
national flag and I truly believe when you

play against Brasil, you don't play against
eleven, you play against 200 million people

that support the team. We try to honour and
respect that.

When kids in Brasil start walking they already
have a ball at their feet.
Playing for the Selecao is ever child's dream.

It's a big dream though and not everyone can
reach it.
But every child that achieves this goal,
to become part of the national team, it will be an unforgettable dream.

I noticed that David was a natural talent
when he was in his mom's womb because he used to kick her a lot.

He used to play with a ball all the time.
No matter what size.

I remember the game. It was when I was 100%
sure that he will one day play for Brasil.
He was playing for a team from Bahia
and it was in that game that he demonstrated  he wanted to achieve what he has achieved.
I remember when he was playing in Portugal.

He was asked to change his citizenship to
be able to play for the Portuguese football team, he answered
"the blood running in my veins is green and yellow,
my heart it Brasilian and I will only play for my country"

If you answer like that as an adult, I can
only assume you have made that decision as a child.

To be a Brasilian citizen is already something
difficult to explain.
To be patriotic.
dressed in green and yellow.

This is the moment when everyone is united,
people forget about this rivalries and else and are together for the same reason.

And being a father watching your son play
for the Brasilian team, makes my dreams come true.

title: Nike Football: David Luiz - Yellow & Green

comments.text:
2:14 my only thought to that part was... try to imagine to be patriotic as 
a german even in the 21st centry it's nearly impossible without someone 
coming by and saying "nationalism", "nazi" "racist idiot"... It's nearly 
impossible showing that you are "proud" being a german or enjoy being one 
without being depicted as a nazi OUTSIDE of the World Cup... that's like 
the only time where german can show something that has the colours 
black,red and gold... and in the last WC some people ran around breaking 
those car-window-flag-thingys (if you know what i mean) saying things like, 
"thats just not right", "thats dangerous nationalism" and so on... It just 
makes me sad... :( Only because many of our ancestors f*cked up big time 
(and that's still kinda soft-said), it feels like germans are not allowed 
anymore to be proud of their country like everybody else of theirs... Just 
to make sure... I came here for football, not for crying around in the 
comment section... it just made me think of this stuff so I had to post it 
:/
Have a nice Day/Night :)﻿

comments.text:
+miki mad
I think you are good and appreciable that if some guy gets blasted, you 
feel the unease for that guy; this is empathy.
Unfortunately the disrespecting words from Johnny Starr is due to the 
currently objective fact that "Luiz is overrated". No one here at least can 
overthrow this argument.
If you have the empathy, you should also understand or imagine e.g. (assume 
Johnny Starr is a Brazil fans) how disappointing that is to see Brazil 
failed that badly, that Luiz shared an un-negligible responsibility, that 
people have rights to feel angry towards him.
Indeed everybody (can say) is righteous to feel angry towards an overrated 
person who receive many goodness for his overrated position, but turns out 
did not contribute what - should be expected from him. Many people work 
hard, but overrated is overrated, working hard is not an excuse to take an 
overrated position. There is a chinese motto, translate to english which is 
like "way up to the top of the top of a mountain, there are unbearable 
chills"

comments.text:
He should NOT have the fingers pointed at him! Just because he was captain, 
does not mean he should be blamed for the 7-1 loss. They went out as a team 
and lost as a team, and the explanation to the loss should be accounted as 
a team. Personally i think that, the Brazilians could have been 3 goals 
back within the first 20 minutes of the second half, but Germany is just 
too strong. Solid team, that plays perfect football, basically like Spanish 
football but 3 times quicker, and much more, way more lethal and tactical 
in the final third of attacking in the 18 yard box. To be honest, Brazil 
could have been better with the following players: Ronaldinnho, Lucas, 
Coutinho, Kaka, players who have experience and young talents similar to 
Neymar. ﻿
